result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: (Submitted to Accts Payable 10/24/22; invoice mailed to Def for reimbursement)
for Modification of Bond
for Payment of Attorneys Fees (with Letter)

AMENDED 09/30/22: Court amends the no contact to "No contact with the victim without permission of the agent. phone or text contact is still permitted.
AMENDED 09/22/22: Court orders that the defendant may have phone or text contact only with the victim. 

No direct or indirect contact with the victim. (EAE) No direct or indirect contact with the victims child(ren). Not to be in or driving though the township or village of Muscoda. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances with out a valid prescription and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on
demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Phoenix Center included.

9:10 AM Defendant Lance M Cook in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Lance M Cook.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper and Attorney Ocwieja state the joint agreement to DRI; count 1, count 2 will be 2 years probation and count 3 will be probation for 3 years. Court goes over the plea/questionnaire. Attorney Ocwieja stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds a factual basis. Defendant enters a plea of guilty. 

Count 2: Court finds the defendant guilty, withhold judgment of conviction and approves the 3 year DPA. 

Attorney Harper heard on count 3. Attorney Ocwieja heard about the probation sentence.

Count 3: Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 2 years; consecutive to any jail sentence.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances with out a valid prescription and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on
demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Phoenix Center included.

9:24 AM Defendant Lance M Cook in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Lance M Cook.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ocwieja states that  they will be waiving the preliminary hearing; asking for a plea and sentencing dates and that the document has been efiled. Attorney Ocwieja also states that a motion to modify bond was file as well. Court goes over the waiver of preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial.

Attorney Harper will be filing the information that being forth that same charges. Attorney Ocwieja waives the formal reading and stands mute on behalf his clients behalf.  Max penalties stated. Court directs the clerk to enter NG plea on all counts. 

Attorney Harper would like to speak about the motion to modify the no contact. Attorney Harper heard and objects to the motion to modify. Attorney Harper reads the letter from the victim. Court speaks about the information in the case.

Court will amend the bond to allow phone or texting contact only with the victim.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for Bond Modification

9/14 Preliminary hearing reset to accommodate the DA and Richland County jury trial

9:08 AM Defendant Lance M Cook appeared by video, in custody at the Grant County Jail.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by phone for Lance M Cook. Attorney Ocwieja has review the complaint and waives the formal reading. Max penalties were stated before on July 15, 2022. Attorney Ocwieja waives the time limit to have a preliminary hearing. Attorney Ocwieja states that he is on a probation hold and notes that the sentencing after revocation in Grant County hasn't been set yet. Court asks for an order to produce for the preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is ordered to deposit $300 once he has received his taxes and then after post $100 a month. Defendant must fill out the payment plan with the clerk of court office.

9:25 AM Defendant Lance M Cook appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. LC states that he is in Grant County due to a probation hold.  LC doesn't know how long he is going to be in custody. Court speaks about the petition of  counsel.  

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney O .
Court states that once the defendant get his taxes back then he will post $300 and then after that $100 a month. Court will review these items once released to make sure paperwork has been filed out and money has been deposited.
